greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows (n >= 0, 0 <= k <= n, m = 3); T(n,k) = Sum{j=0..m} Sum{i=0..m} (-1)^(j+i)*C(i,j)*n^j*k^(m-j).
comment: Read as an infinite symmetric square array, this is the table A(n,k)=(n+k)(n^2+k^2), cf. A321500 for the triangle with k <= n. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 22 2018
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n=0..100 of triangle, flattened
example: Can also be seen as the square array A(n,k)=(n+k)*(n^2 + k^2) read by antidiagonals:
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := 2 k^2*n - 2 k*n^2 + n^3; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Amiram Eldar_, Nov 22 2018 *)
program: (Sage) [[ 2*k^2*n-2*k*n^2+n^3 for k in range(n+1)] for n in range(12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 23 2018
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Oct 26 2011
